quote: Flowers grow out of dark moments.
author: Corita Kent

quote: I have brightness in my soul  which strains toward Heaven. I am like a bird!
author: Jenny Lind

quote: When it is dark enough  you can see the stars.
author: Charles A. Beard

quote: All sorts of spiritual gifts come through privations  if they are accepted.
author: Janet Erskine Stuart

quote: There is nothing the body suffers which the soul may not profit by.
author: George Meredith

quote: Often God has to shut a door in our face  so that He can subsequently open the door through which He wants us to go.
author: Catharine Marshall

quote: God will not look you over for medals  degrees or diplomas  but for scars.
author: Anonymous

quote: He who serves God with what costs him nothing  will do very little service  you may depend on it.
author: Susan Warner

quote: There are three modes of bearing the ills of life: by indifference  by philosophy  and by religion.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Sorrow has its reward. It never leaves us where it found us.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: The same reason makes a man a religious enthusiast that makes a man an enthusiast in any other way: an uncomfortable mind in an uncomfortable body.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Adversity introduces a man to himself.
author: Anonymous

quote: Constant success shows us but one side of the world  adversity brings out the reverse of the picture.
author: Walter Colton

quote: Prosperity is a great teacher  adversity is a greater. Possession pampers the mind  privation trains and strengthens it.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Sweet are the uses of adversity  Which  like the toad  ugly and venomous  Wears yet a precious jewel in his head.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: There is no education like adversity.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The incessant witless repetition of advertisers' moron-fodder has become so much a part of life that if we are not careful  we forget to be insulted by it.
author: The London Times

quote: There is no such thing as bad publicity except your own obituary.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: The advertisements in a newspaper are more full of knowledge in respect to what is going on in a state or community than the editorial columns are.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: If it doesn't sell  it isn't creative.
author: David Ogilvy

quote: In advertising not to be different is virtually suicidal.
author: Bill Bernback

quote: Advertising - a judicious mixture of flattery and threats.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: Advertising may be described as the science of arresting the human intelligence long enough to get money from it.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: The best ad is a good product.
author: Alan H. Meyer

quote: The philosophy behind much advertising is based on the old observation that every man is really two men - the man he is and the man he wants to be.
author: William Feather

quote: The number of agency people required to shoot a commercial on location is in direct proportion to the mean temperature of the location.
author: Shelby Page

quote: Advertising is the most fun you can have with your clothes on.
author: Jerry Delia Femina

quote: Buy me and you will overcome the anxieties I have just reminded you of.
author: Michael Schudson

quote: If I were starting life over again  I am inclined to think that I would go into the advertising business in preference to almost any other. The general raising of standards of modern civilization among all groups of people during the past half-century would have been impossible without that spreading of the knowledge of higher standards by means of advertising.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Promise  large promise  is the soul of an advertisement.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The deeper problems connected with advertising come less from the unscrupulousness of our 'deceivers' than from our pleasure in being deceived  less from the desire to seduce than from the desire to be seduced.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: Ads are the cave art of the twentieth century.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: The advertisement is one of the most interesting and difficult of modern literary forms.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: What kills a skunk is the publicity it gives itself.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Few people at the beginning of the nineteenth century needed an adman to tell them what they wanted.
author: J. K. Galbraith

quote: The art of publicity is a black art.
author: Learned Hand

quote: Advertising is legalized lying.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Advertising is what you do when you can't go to see somebody. That's all it is.
author: Fairfax Cone

quote: The consumer is not a moron. She's your wife.
author: David Ogilvy

quote: When business is good it pays to advertise  when business is bad you've got to advertise.
author: Anonymous

quote: You can tell the ideals of a nation by its advertisements.
author: George Norman Douglas

quote: Advertisements contain the only truth to be relied on in a newspaper.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: But one must know where one stands  and where the others wish to go.
author: Goethe

quote: No man ever listened himself out of a job.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Thanksgiving comes after Christmas.
author: Peter Kreeft

quote: The proverb warns that  "You should not bite the hand that feeds you." But maybe you should  if it prevents you from feeding yourself.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: I remember my father telling me the story of the preacher delivering an exhortation to his flock  and as he reached the climax of his exhortation  a man in the front row got up and said  'O Lord  use me. Use me  O Lord - in an advisory capacity!'
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: Be frank and explicit. That is the right line to take when you wish to conceal your own mind and to confuse the minds of others.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: To make pleasure pleasant  shorten.
author: Charles Buxton

quote: Put all thine eggs in one basket and - watch that basket.
author: Mark Twain

quote: It has seemed to be more necessary to have regard to the weight of words rather than to their number.
author: Cicero

quote: Don't offer me advice  give me money.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: If you aren't rich  you should always look useful.
author: Louis-Ferdinand Celine

quote: He who can lick can bite.
author: French proverb

quote: When a man comes to me for advice  I find out the kind of advice he wants  and I give it to him.
author: Josh Billings

quote: We only make a dupe of the friend whose advice we ask  for we never tell him all  and it is usually what we have left unsaid that decides our conduct.
author: Diane de Poitiers

quote: I give myself  sometimes  admirable advice  but I am incapable of taking it.
author: Mary Wortley Montagu

quote: Advice is like snow  the softer it falls  the longer it dwells upon  and the deeper it sinks into  the mind.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: The true secret of giving advice is  after you have honestly given it  to be perfectly indifferent whether it is taken or not and never persist in trying to set people right.
author: Hannah Whitall Smith

quote: 'Be yourself!' is about the worst advice you can give to some people.
author: Tom Masson

quote: A bull does not enjoy fame in two herds.
author: Rhodesian proverb

quote: The advice of the elders to young men is very apt to be as unreal as a list of the hundred best books.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Fewer things are harder to put up with than the annoyance of a good example.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A good scare is worth more to a man than good advice.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: There is little serenity comparable to the serenity of the inexperienced giving advice to the experienced.
author: Anonymous

quote: Advice is seldom welcome  and those who want it the most always like it the least.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: It is well enough  when one is talking to a friend  to lodge in an odd word by way of counsel now and then  but there is something mighty irksome in its staring upon one in a letter  where one ought to see only kind words and friendly remembrances.
author: Mary Lamb

quote: Men of much depth of mind can bear a great deal of counsel  for it does not easily deface their own character  nor render their purposes indistinct.
author: Arthur Helps

quote: Have more than thou showest  Speak less than thou knowest.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: What you don't see with your eyes  don't invent with your tongue.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: If you keep your mind sufficiently open  people will throw a lot of rubbish into it.
author: William A. Orton

quote: Don't fight forces  use them.
author: Buckminster Fuller

quote: Drink nothing without seeing it  sign nothing without reading it.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: What is important is to keep learning  to enjoy challenge  and to tolerate ambiguity. In the end there are no certain answers.
author: Marina Horner

quote: Simplicity  simplicity  simplicity. I say  let your affairs be as two or three  and not a hundred or a thousand  instead of a million count half a dozen  and keep your accounts on your thumbnail.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: You must not think  sir  to catch old birds with chaff.
author: Cervantes

quote: Never give advice in a crowd.
author: Arab proverb

quote: Never give advice unless asked.
author: German proverb

quote: Whatever advice you give  be short.
author: Horace

quote: Old men are fond of giving good advice  to console themselves for being no longer in a position to give bad examples.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: We give advice  but we do not inspire conduct.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Good counsel has no price.
author: Guiseppe Mazzini

quote: Never advise anyone to go to war or to marry.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Many receive advice  only the wise profit by it.
author: Syrus

quote: Admonish your friends privately  but praise them openly.
author: Syrus

quote: The eternal stars shine out as soon as it is dark enough.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Whom the Lord loveth he chasteneth.
author: Bible

quote: Be still  sad heart  and cease repining  Behind the clouds the sun is shining  Thy fate is the common fate of all  Into each life some rain must fall  -  Some days must be dark and dreary.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: It is always in season for old men to learn.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Youth is a blunder  Manhood a struggle  Old Age a regret.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: To know how to grow old is the master work of wisdom  and one of the most difficult chapters in the great art of living.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Old wood best to burn  old wine to drink  old friends to trust  and old authors to read.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: At 20 years of age the will reigns  at 30 the wit  at 40 the judgment.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: If wrinkles must be written upon our brows  let them not be written upon the heart. The spirit should not grow old.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: The riders in a race do not stop short when they reach the goal. There is a little finishing canter before coming to a standstill. There is time to hear the kind voice of friends and to say to one's self: "The work is done."
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Study until twenty-five  investigation until forty  profession until sixty  at which age I would have him retired on a double allowance.
author: William Osier

quote: In youth the days are short and the years are long  in old age the years are short and the days long.
author: Panin

quote: The days of our years are threescore years and ten  and if by reason of strength they be fourscore years  yet is their strength labour and sorrow  for it is soon cut off  and we fly away.
author: Bible

quote: The first forty years of life give us the text  the next thirty supply the commentary on it.
author: Schopenhauer

quote: Age cannot wither her  nor custom stale Her infinite variety.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: An old man is twice a child.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The old believe everything: the middle-aged suspect everything: the young know everything.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Age and treachery will triumph over youth and skill.
author: Anonymous

quote: All the best sands of my life are somehow getting into the wrong end of the hourglass. If I could only reverse it! Were it in my power to do so  would I?
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: All would live long  but none would be old.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: An old man concludeth from his knowing mankind that they know him too  and that maketh him very wary.
author: George Saville

quote: An old man loved is Winter with flowers.
author: German proverb

quote: An older author is constantly rediscovering himself in the more or less fossilized productions of his earlier years.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: But  Lord Crist! whan that it remembreth me Upon my yowthe  and on my jolitee  It tickleth me aboute myn herte roote. Unto this day it dooth myn herte boote That I have had my world as in my tyme. But age  alias! that al wole envenyme  Hath me biraft my beautee and my pith. Lat go  farewel! the devel go therwith! The flour is goon  ther is namoore to telle  The bren  as I best kan  now most I selle.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: Grow old with me! The best is yet to be  The last of life  for which the first was made: Our times are in his hands Who sayeth "a whole I plant  Youth shows but half  Trust God  see all nor be afraid."
author: Robert Browning

quote: Growing old is like being increasingly penalized for a crime you have not committed.
author: Anthony Powell

quote: Here's a new day. 0 Pendulum move slowly!
author: Harold Munro

quote: I am 65 and I guess that puts me in with the geriatrics. But if there were 15 months in every year  I'd only be 48. That's the trouble with us. We number everything. Take women  for example  I think they deserve to have more than 12 years between the ages of 28 and 40.
author: James Thurber

quote: I am just turning 40 and taking my time about it.
author: Harold Lloyd

quote: I haven't asked you to make me young again. All I want is to go on getting older.
author: Konrad Adenauer

quote: I refuse to admit that I am more than 52  even if that makes my sons illegitimate.
author: Nancy Lady Astor

quote: If I'd known I was gonna live this long (100 years)  I'd have taken better care of myself.
author: James Hubert Blake

quote: If the young only knew  if the old only could.
author: French saying

quote: Is it not strange that desire should so many years outlive performance?
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Middle age snuffs out more talent than even wars or sudden deaths do.
author: Richard Hughes

quote: Old age is the Outpatient's Dept of purgatory.
author: Lord Cecil

quote: Old age takes away from us what we have inherited and gives us what we have earned.
author: Gerald Brenan

quote: The difference between being an elder statesman And posing successfully as an elder statesman Is practically negligible.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: The old repeat themselves and the young have nothing to say. The boredom is mutual.
author: Jacques Bainville

quote: There is many a good tune played on an old fiddle.
author: Old saying

quote: Time goes by: reputation increases  ability declines.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: To keep the heart unwrinkled  to be hopeful  kindly  cheerful  reverent -that is to triumph over old age.
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: We do not die wholly at our deaths: we have moldered away gradually long before. Faculty after faculty  interest after interest  attachment after attachment disappear: we are torn from ourselves while living.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Wrinkles - the service stripes of life.
author: Anonymous

quote: To be seventy years young is sometimes far more cheerful and hopeful than to be forty years old.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: One of the delights known to age  and beyond the grasp of youth  is that of 'not going'!
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: A man of sixty has spent twenty years in bed and over three years in eating.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: The role of a retired person is no longer to possess one.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Middle age: when you're sitting at home on Saturday night and the telephone rings and you hope it isn't for you.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: No Spring  nor Summer beauty hath such grace  As I have seen in one Autumnal face.
author: John Donne

quote: If you live long enough the venerability factor creeps in  you get accused of things you never did and praised for virtues you never had.
author: I. F. Stone

quote: I advise you to go on living solely to enrage those who are paying your annuities. It is the only pleasure I have left.
author: Voltaire

quote: Growing old is no more than a bad habit which a busy man has no time to form.
author: Andri Maurois

quote: Old age is an island surrounded by death.
author: Juan Montalvo

quote: It is time to be old  To take in sail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I feel age like an icicle down my back.
author: Dyson Carter

quote: Old age is a time of humiliations  the most disagreeable of which  for me  is that I cannot work long at sustained high pressure with no leaks in concentration.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: Dignity  high station  or great riches are in some sort necessary to old men  in order to keep the younger at a distance  who are otherwise too apt to insult them upon the score of their age.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: The young feel tired at the end of an action  The old at the beginning.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Old foxes want no tutors.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Old birds are hard to pluck.
author: German proverb

quote: A man of fifty looks as old as Santa Claus to a girl of twenty.
author: William Feather

quote: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you are?
author: Satchel Paige

quote: The young always have the same problem - how to rebel and conform at the same time. They have now solved this by defying their parents and copying one another.
author: Quentin Crisp

quote: Before you contradict an old man  my fair friend  you should endeavour to understand him.
author: George Santayana

quote: Zsa Zsa Gabor  when asked which of the Gabor women was the oldest  said "She'll never admit it  but I believe it is Mama." When men grow virtuous in their old age  they only make a sacrifice to God of the devil's leavings.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: When you are forty  half of you belongs to the past. . . And when you are seventy  nearly all of you.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: To an old man any place that's warm is homeland.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: By the time a man gets well into his seventies his continued existence is a mere miracle.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: One trouble with growing older is that it gets progressively tougher to find a famous historical figure who didn't amount to much when he was your age.
author: Bill Vaughan

quote: Forty is the old age of youth  fifty is the youth of old age.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Middle age is youth without its levity  And age without decay.
author: Daniel Defoe

quote: And he (King David) died in a good old age  full of days  riches and honour.
author: Bible

quote: I never dared be radical when young For fear it would make me conservative when old.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Old age is by nature rather talkative.
author: Cicero

quote: Old age  especially an honoured old age  has so great authority  that this is of more value than all the pleasures of youth.
author: Cicero

quote: Age has a good mind and sorry shanks.
author: Pietro Aretino

quote: To me  old age is always fifteen years older than I am.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: Few people know how to be old.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: First you forget names  then you forget faces  then you forget to pull your zipper up  then you forget to pull your zipper down.
author: Leo Rosenberg

quote: I really believe that more harm is done by old men who cling to their influence than by young men who anticipate it.
author: Owen D. Young

quote: He had come to that time in his life (it varies for every man) when a human being gives himself over to his demon or to his genius  according to a mysterious law which orders him either to destroy or to surpass himself.
author: Marguerite Yourcenar

quote: The individual succumbs  but he does not die if he has left something to mankind.
author: Will Durant

quote: It is always in season for old men to learn.
author: Aeschylus

quote: So  lively brisk old fellow  don't let age get you down. White hairs or not  you can still be a lover.
author: Goethe

quote: He that has seen both sides of fifty has lived to little purpose if he has no other views of the world than he had when he was much younger.
author: William Cowper

quote: Let us respect gray hairs  especially our own.
author: J. P. Senn

quote: The spiritual eyesight improves as the physical eyesight declines.
author: Plato

quote: A man over ninety is a great comfort to all his elderly neighbours: he is a picket-guard at the extreme outpost: and the young folks of sixty and seventy feel that the enemy must get by him before he can come near their camp.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: An old codger  rampant  and still learning.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: A person is always startled when he hears himself seriously called an old man for the first time.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Many a man that couldn't direct ye to th' drug store on th' corner when he was thirty will get a respectful hearin' when age has further impaired his mind.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: The denunciation of the young is a necessary part of the hygiene of older people  and greatly assists the circulation of their blood.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Never have I enjoyed youth so thoroughly as I have in my old age. In writing Dialogues in Limbo  The Last Puritan  and now all these descriptions of the friends of my youth and the young friends of my middle age  I have drunk the pleasure of life more pure  more joyful than it ever was when mingled with all the hidden anxieties and little annoyances of actual living. Nothing is inherently and invincibly young except spirit. And spirit can enter a human being perhaps better in the quiet of old age and dwell there more undisturbed than in the turmoil of adventure.
author: George Santayana

quote: The arctic loneliness of age.
author: S. Weir Mitchell

quote: When pain ends  gain ends too.
author: Robert Browning

quote: No gains without pains.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: Longevity is having a chronic disease and taking care of it.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Age is a high price to pay for maturity.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: I'm very pleased with each advancing year. It stems back to when I was forty. I was a bit upset about reaching that milestone  but an older friend consoled me. 'Don't complain about growing old - many people don't have that privilege.'
author: Earl Warren

quote: When I was very young  I was disgracefully intolerant but when I passed the thirty mark I prided myself on having learned the beautiful lesson that all things were good  and equally good. That  however  was really laziness. Now  thank goodness  I've sorted out what matters and what doesn't. And I'm beginning to be intolerant again.
author: G. B. Stern

quote: It is the fear of being as dependent as a young child  while not being loved as a child is loved  but merely being kept alive against one's will.
author: Malcolm Cowley

quote: Happy the man who gains sagacity in youth  but thrice happy he who retains the fervour of youth in age.
author: Dagobert Runes

quote: Your old men shall dream dreams  your young men shall see visions.
author: Bible

quote: I am long on ideas  but short on time. I expect to live only about a hundred years.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: How beautifully the leaves grow old. How full of light and colour are their last days.
author: John Burroughs

quote: In the last few years everything I'd done up to sixty or so has seemed very childish.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: What makes old age so sad is not that our joys but our hopes cease.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: The young man knows the rules but the old man knows the exceptions.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: To know how to grow old is the master-work of wisdom  and one of the most difficult chapters in the great art of living.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: When you reach your sixties  you have to decide whether you're going to be a sot or an ascetic. In other words if you want to go on working after you're sixty  some degree of asceticism is inevitable.
author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote: Yes  I'm 68  but when I was a boy I was too poor to smoke  so knock off ten years. That makes me 58. And since I never developed the drinking habit  you can knock off ten more years. So I'm 48 - in the prime of my life. Retire? Retire to what?
author: W. A. C. Bennett

quote: Life has got to be lived - that's all there is to it. At seventy  I would say the advantage is that you take life more calmly. You know that 'this  too  shall pass!'
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Senescence begins And middle age ends  The day your descendants Outnumber your friends.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: On the day of his death  in his eightieth year  Elliot  'the Apostle of the Indians ' was found teaching an Indian child at his bedside. 'Why not to rest from your labours now?' asked a friend. 'Because ' replied the venerable man  'I have prayed God to render me useful in my sphere  and he has heard my prayers  for now that I can no longer preach  he leaves me strength enough to teach this poor child the alphabet.'
author: S. Chaplin

quote: As the world is wearie of me so am I of it.
author: John Knox

quote: Middle age is when you have a choice of two temptations and choose the one that will get you home earlier.
author: Anonymous

quote: No wise man ever wished to be younger.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Every man who has lived his life to the full should  by the time his senior years are reached  have established a reserve inventory of unfinished thinking.
author: Clarence Randall

quote: For the unlearned  old age is winter  for the learned  it is the season of the harvest.
author: Hasidic saying

quote: My opportunities were still there  nay  they multiplied tenfold  but the strength and youth to cope with them began to fail  and to need eking out with the shifty cunning of experience.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: I must be getting absent-minded. Whenever I complain that things aren't what they used to be  I always forget to include myself.
author: George Burns

quote: We grow neither better nor worse as we get old  but more like ourselves
author: May Lamberton Becker

quote: Golden lads and girls all must  As chimney-sweepers  come to dust.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: It's never too late to have a fling For autumn is just as nice as spring And it's never too late to fall in love.
author: Sandy Wilson

quote: Growing old - it's not nice  but it's interesting.
author: August Strindberg

quote: If you think that I am going to bother myself again before I die about social improvement  or read any of those stinking upward and onwarders - you err - I mean to have some good out of being old.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: They tell you that you'll lose your mind when you grow older. What they don't tell you is that you won't miss it very much.
author: Malcolm Cowley

quote: I have learned little from the years that fly  but I have wrung the colour from the years.
author: Frances Pollock

quote: Earth is here so kind  that just tickle her with a hoe and she laughs with a harvest.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: A field becomes exhausted by constant tillage.
author: Ovid

quote: Praise a large domain  cultivate a small estate.
author: Virgil

quote: Blessed be agriculture! If one does not have too much of it.
author: Charles Dudley

quote: When tillage begins  other arts follow. The farmers  therefore  are the founders of human civilization.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: When you are aspiring to the highest place  it is honorable to reach the second or even the third rank.
author: Cicero

quote: Hitch your wagon to a star.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Most people would succeed in small things if they were not troubled with great ambitions.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Better to reign in hell than serve in heaven.
author: John Milton

quote: When that the poor have cried  Caesar hath wept: Ambition should be made of sterner stuff: Yet Brutus says he was ambitious  And Brutus is an honourable man.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: If you wish to reach the highest  begin at the lowest.
author: Syrus

quote: Ambition destroys its possessor.
author: Talmud

quote: Ambition has but one reward for all: A little power  a little transient fame  A grave to rest in  and a fading name!
author: William Winter

quote: There is nothing wrong with America that cannot be cured by what is right with America.
author: President William J. Clinton

quote: The office of the president is such a bastardized thing  half royalty and half democracy  that nobody knows whether to genuflect or spit.
author: Jimmy Breslin

quote: Part of the American dream is to live long and die young.
author: Edgar Z. Friedenberg

quote: America is so vast that almost everything said about it is likely to be true  and the opposite is probably equally true.
author: James T. Farrell

quote: American youth attributes much more importance to arriving at driver's license age than at voting age.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: If ever there was an aviary overstocked with jays it is that Yaptown-on-the-Hudson called New York.
author: O. Henry

quote: If you don't want to use the army  I should like to borrow it for a while. Yours respectfully
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Let's talk sense to the American people. Let's tell them the truth  that there are no gains without pains.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: Ours is the country where  in order to sell your product  you don't so much point out its merits as you first work like hell to sell yourself.
author: Louis Kronenberger

quote: People who leave Washington D.C. do so by way of the box - ballot or coffin.
author: Claiborne Pell

quote: Poor Mexico  so far from God and so near to the United States.
author: Porfirio Diaz

quote: That strange blend of the commercial traveller  the missionary and the barbarian conqueror  which was the American abroad.
author: Olaf Stapledon

quote: The faces in New York remind me of people who played a game ! and lost.
author: Murray Kepton

quote: The President spends most of his time kissing people on the cheek in order to get them to do what they ought to do without getting kissed.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: The real America that Whitman proclaimed and Thoreau decoded.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: Thou  oh my country  hast thy foolish ways  Too apt to purr at every stranger's praise.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: You can always get the truth from an American statesman after he has turned 70  or given up all hope of the Presidency.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: America is a willingness of the heart.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: (A country where) the young are always ready to give to those who are older than themselves the full benefits of their inexperience.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: We are now at the point where we must decide whether we are to honour the concept of a plural society which gains strength through diversity  or whether we are to have bitter fragmentation that will result in perpetual tension and strife.
author: Earl Warren

quote: Nothing ever gets settled in this town (Washington). It's not like running a company or even a university. It's a seething debating society  in which the debate never stops  in which people never give up  including me  and that's the atmosphere in which you administer.
author: George P. Shultz

quote: The skyline of New York is a monument of a splendour that no pyramids or palaces will ever equal or approach.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Whoever wants to know the hearts and minds of America had better learn baseball.
author: Jacques Barzun

quote: Americans are like a rich father who wishes he knew how to give his son the hardships that made him rich.
author: Robert Frost

quote: America... an economic system prouder of the distribution of its products than of the products themselves.
author: Murray Kempton

quote: The United States was born in the country and moved to the city in the nineteenth century.
author: Anonymous

quote: Delaware: a state that has three counties when the tide is out  and two when it is in.
author: J. J. Ingalls

quote: Washington is an endless series of mock palaces clearly built for clerks.
author: Ada Louise Huxtable

quote: The Americans believe they answered all first questions in 1776: since then they've just been hammering out the practical details.
author: Ray Smith

quote: Our national flower is the concrete cloverleaf.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: Americans have a special horror of letting things happen their own way  without interference. They would like to jump down their stomachs  digest the food  and shovel the shit out.
author: William Burroughs

quote: When asked by an anthropologist what the Indians called America before the white man came  an Indian said simply 'Ours.'
author: Vine Deloria

quote: In the United States 'First' and 'Second' class can't be painted on railroad cars  for all passengers  being Americans  are equal and it would be 'unAmerican.' But paint 'Pullman' on a car and everyone is satisfied.
author: Owen Wister

quote: The true America is the Middle West  and Columbus discovered nothing at all except another Europe.
author: W. L. George

quote: America once had the clarity of a pioneer axe.
author: Robert Osborn

quote: In the United States there is more space where nobody is than where anybody is. This is what makes America what it is.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: You say to your soldier  'Do this' and he does it. But I am obliged to say to the American  'This is why you ought to do this' and then he does it.
author: Baron von Steuben

quote: The greatest American superstition is belief in facts.
author: Hermann Keyserling

quote: America should care more for its poor and reform itself in other ways  but even if it won't do those things  it remains the least constrained society on earth.
author: Robert M. Adams

quote: Florida: God's waiting room.
author: Glenn le Grice

quote: The Englishman is under no constitutional obligation to believe that all men are created equal. The American agony is therefore scarcely intelligible  like a saint's self-flagellation viewed by an atheist.
author: John Updike

quote: There is nothing the matter with Americans except their ideals. The real American is all right  it is the ideal American who is all wrong.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Nobody ever went broke underestimating the taste of the American public.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Good Americans  when they die  go to Paris.
author: Thomas Gold Appleton

quote: The sorrows and disasters of Europe always brought fortune to America.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: The American's conversation is much like his courtship ... He gives an inkling and watches for a reaction  if the weather looks fair  he inkles a little more. Wishing neither to intrude nor be intruded upon  he advances by stages of acceptance  by levels of agreement  by steps of concurrence.
author: Donald Lloyd

quote: The central fact of North American history is that there were fifteen British Colonies before 1776. Thirteen rebelled and two did not.
author: June Callwood

quote: A natural New Yorker is a native of the present tense.
author: V. S. Pritchett

quote: New York is notoriously inhospitable to the past  disowning it whenever it can.
author: John D. Rosenberg

quote: Why  if you're not in New York you are camping out.
author: Thomas W. Dewing

quote: That enfabled rock  that ship of life  that swarming  million-footed  tower-masted  sky-soaring citadel that bears the magic name of the Island of Manhattan.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: I don't like the life here in New York. There is no greenery. It would make a stone sick.
author: Nikita Khrushchev

quote: New York  the nation's thyroid gland.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: You will find the Americans much as the Greeks found the Romans: great  big  vulgar  bustling people more vigorous than we are and also more idle  with more unspoiled virtues but also more corrupt.
author: Harold Macmillan

quote: As for what you're calling hard luck - well  we made New England out of it. That and codfish.
author: Stephen Vincent Benet

quote: The lusts of the flesh can be gratified anywhere  it is not this sort of licence that distinguishes New York. It is  rather  a lust of the total ego for recognition  even for eminence. More than elsewhere  everybody here wants to be Somebody.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: After twenty annual visits  I am still surprised each time I return to see this giant asparagus bed of alabaster and rose and green skyscrapers.
author: Cecil Beaton

quote: He speaks English with the flawless imperfection of a New Yorker.
author: Gilbert Millstein

quote: A town that has no ceiling price  A town of double-talk  A town so big men name her twice  Like so: 'N'Yawk  N'Yawk.'
author: Christopher Morley

quote: And this is good old Boston The home of the bean and the cod - Where the Lowells talk to the Cabots  And the Cabots talk only to God.
author: J. C. Bossidy

quote: New England is a finished place. Its destiny is that of Florence or Venice  not Milan  while the American empire careens onward toward its predicted end ... it is the first American section to be finished  to achieve stability in the conditions of its life. It is the first old civilization  the first permanent civilization in America.
author: Bernard de Voto

quote: A Bostonian - an American  broadly speaking.
author: G. E. Woodberry

quote: The swaggering underemphasis of New England.
author: Heywood Broun

quote: A well-established village in New England or the northern Middle-West could afford a town drunkard  a town atheist  and a few Democrats.
author: D. W. Brogan

quote: I shall enter on no encomium upon Massachussets  she needs none. There she is. Behold her  and judge for yourselves.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: The most serious charge which can be brought against New England is not Puritanism but February.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: Boston is a moral and intellectual nursery always busy applying first principles to trifles.
author: George Santayana

quote: America - the best poor man's country in the world.
author: William Allen

quote: Chicago - a facade of skyscrapers facing a lake and behind the facade every type of dubiousness.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: I'm from Indiana  the home of more first-rate second-class men than any other state in the union.
author: Thomas R. Marshall

quote: Pennsylvania  the state that has produced two great men: Benjamin Franklin of Massachusetts  and Albert Gallatin of Switzerland.
author: J. J. Ingalls

quote: Stormy  husky  brawling  City of the Big Shoulders.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: I come from a state that raises corn and cotton and cockleburs and Democrats  and frothy eloquence neither convinces nor satisfies me. I am from Missouri. You have got to show me.
author: Willard D. Vandiver

quote: Washington is a place where men praise courage and act on elaborate personal cost-benefit calculations.
author: J. K. Galbraith

quote: I think that New York is not the cultural centre of America  but the business and administrative centre of American culture.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: Washington is a city of people doing badly what shouldn't be done at all.
author: Robert H. Gurney

quote: America and its demons  Europe and its ghosts.
author: Le Monde

quote: 0 beautiful for patriot dream That sees beyond the years Thine alabaster cities gleam Undimmed by human tears! America! America! God shed his grace on thee  And crown thy good with brotherhood From sea to shining sea!
author: Katharine Lee Bates

quote: America is a country of young men.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Hail  Columbia! happy land! Hail  ye heroes! heavenborn band! Who fought and bled in Freedom's cause.
author: Joseph Hopkinson

quote: America is a tune. It must be sung together.
author: Gerald Stanley Lee

quote: Thou  too  sail on  O Shipof State! Sail on  O Union  strong and great! Humanity with all its fears  With all the hopes of future years  Is hanging breathless on thy fate!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Only those Americans who are willing to die for their country are fit to live.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: I was born an American  I live an American  I shall die an American.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: Some Americans need hyphens in their names  because only part of them has come over  but when the whole man has come over  heart and thought and all  the hyphen drops of its own weight out of his name.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: This generation of Americans has a rendezvous with destiny.
author: F. D. Roosevelt

quote: America is God's crucible  the great Melting-Pot where all the races of Europe are melting and reforming!... The Real American has not yet arived. He is only in the crucible  Itell you - he will be the fusion of all races  the common superman.
author: Israel Zangwill

quote: A degenerate nobleman  or one that is proud of his birth  is like a turnip. There is nothing good of him but that which is underground.
author: Nicholas Murray Butler

quote: My father was a Creole  his father a Negro  and his father a monkey  my family  it seems  begins where yours left off.
author: Alexander Dumas

quote: There is no king who has not had a slave among his ancestors  and no slave who has not had a king among his.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Noble ancestry makes a poor dish at table.
author: Italian proverb

quote: People who take no pride in the noble achievements of remote ancestors will never achieve anything worthy to be remembered with pride by remote descendants.
author: Macaulay

quote: Whoever serves his country well has no need of ancestors.
author: Voltaire

quote: Anger is one of the sinners of the soul.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: It's my rule never to lose my temper until it would be detrimental to keep it.
author: Sean O'Casey

quote: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: Never forget what a man says to you when he is angry.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Who can refute a sneer?
author: William Paley

quote: I never work better than when I am inspired by anger  for when I am angry  I can write  pray  and preach well  for then my whole temperament is quickened  my understanding sharpened  and all mundane vexations and temptations depart.
author: Martin Luther

quote: There is no passion so much transports the sincerity of judgement as doth anger.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Don't get mad  get even.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quote: Beware the fury of a patient man.
author: John Dryden

quote: I was angry with my friend: I told my wrath  my wrath did end. I was angry with my foe: I told it not  my wrath did grow.
author: William Blake

quote: A good indignation brings out all one's powers.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Anger makes dull men witty  but it keeps them poor.
author: Anonymous

quote: Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned  Nor hell a fury like a woman scorned.
author: William Congreve

quote: Anger as soon as fed is dead - Tis starving makes it fat.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Many people lose their tempers merely from seeing you keep yours.
author: Frank Moore Colby

quote: Men often make up in wrath what they want in reason.
author: W. R. Alger

quote: Anger makes dull men witty  but it keeps them poor.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: An angry man opens his mouth and shuts up his eyes.
author: Anonymous

quote: Never answer a letter while you are angry.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: When angry  count four  when very angry  swear.
author: Samuel L. Clemens

quote: Heav'n has no rage  like love to hatred turn'd  Nor Hell a fury  like a woman scorn'd.
author: William Congreve

quote: Beware the fury of a patient man.
author: John Dryden

quote: Anger is momentary madness  so control your passion or it will control you.
author: Horace

quote: Anger blows out the lamp of the mind. In the examination of a great and important question  every one should be serene  slow-pulsed  and calm.
author: Charles J. Ingersoll

quote: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty  and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
author: Bible

quote: A fence should be horse high  hog tight and bull strong.
author: Old saying

quote: A microbe is so very small You cannot make him out at all.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: Cats  no less liquid than their shadows  Offer no angles to the wind. They slip  diminished  Neat  through loopholes Less than themselves.
author: A. S. J. Tessimond

quote: Dogs come when they are called  cats take a message and get back to you.
author: Mary Bly

quote: Hi  handsome hunting man Fire your little gun Bang! Now the animal Is dead and dumb and done. Nevermore to peep again  creep again  leap again Eat or sleep or drink again. Oh  what fun.
author: Walter de la Mare

quote: I loathe people who keep dogs. They are cowards who haven't got the guts to bite people themselves.
author: August Strindberg

quote: If called by a panther Don't anther.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: Of all God's creatures there is only one that cannot be made the slave of the lash. That one is the cat. If man could be crossed with the cat  it would improve man  but it would deteriorate the cat.
author: Mark Twain

quote: To hear the lark begin his flight  And singing startle the dull night. From his watchtower in the skies  Til the dappled dawn doth rise.
author: John Milton

quote: Wee  sleekit  cow'rin  timrous beastie 0 what a panic's in thy breastie! Wi' bickering brattle!
author: Robert Burns

quote: The quizzical expression of the monkey at the zoo comes from his wondering whether he is his brother's keeper  or his keeper's brother.
author: Evan Esar

quote: You have now learned to see That cats are much like you and me And other people whom we find Possessed of various types of mind.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: No animal admires another animal.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The great pleasure of a dog is that you may make a fool of yourself with him and not only will he not scold you  but he will make a fool of himself too.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: All animals are equal  but some animals are more equal than others.
author: George Orwell

quote: To his dog  every man is Napoleon  hence the constant popularity of dogs.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Cats - a standing rebuke to behavioural scientists . . . least human of all creatures.
author: Lewis Thomas

quote: I'd rather have an inch of dog than miles of pedigree.
author: Dana Burnet

quote: Cats seem to go on the principle that it never does any harm to ask for what you want.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: Animals are such agreeable friends - they ask no questions  they pass no criticisms.
author: George Eliot

quote: I never saw a wild thing sorry for itself.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: A robin redbreast in a cage Sets all heaven in a rage.
author: William Blake

quote: I think one reason we admire cats  those of us who do  is their proficiency in one-upmanship. They always seem to come out on top  no matter what they are doing - or pretend they do. Rarely do you see a cat discomfited. They have no conscience  and they never regret. Maybe we secretly envy them.
author: Barbara Webster

quote: I think I could turn and live with animals  they are so placid and self-contain'd  I stand and look at them long and long  They do not sweat and whine about their condition  They do not lie awake in the dark and weep for their sins  They do not make me sick discussing their duty to God  Not one is dissatisfied  not one is demented with the mania of owning things. Not one kneels to another  nor to his kind that liveth thousands of years ago  Not one is respectable or unhappy over the whole earth.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The dog is the god of frolic.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Animals are such agreeable friends  they ask no questions  pass no criticisms.
author: George Eliot

quote: If't were not for my cat and dog  I think I could not live.
author: Ebenezer Elliott

quote: A mule has neither pride of ancestry nor hope of posterity.
author: Charles J. Ingersoll

quote: Men show their superiority inside  animals  outside.
author: Russian proverb

quote: He that fears not the future may enjoy the present.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Grief and constant anxiety kill nearly as many women as men die on the battlefield.
author: Mary Bokin Chesnut

quote: To tremble before anticipated evils is to bemoan what thou hast never lost.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: He who foresees calamities suffers them twice over.
author: Beilby Porteous

quote: He who fears he shall suffer already suffers what he fears.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: If you are afraid for your future  you don't have a present.
author: James Petersen

quote: Nothing in life is more remarkable than the unnecessary anxiety which we endure  and generally create ourselves.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Do not think of all your anxieties  you will only make yourself ill.
author: The Shih King

quote: Only man clogs his happiness with care  destroying what is with thoughts of what may be.
author: John Dryden

quote: I care. I care a lot. I think of "Cosmopolitan" all day  and I run scared. So it's a combination of fright  caring  and anxiety.
author: Helen Gurley Brown

quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths  the valiant never taste of death but once.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Every man  through fear  mugs his aspirations a dozen times a day.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: The mind that is anxious about the future is miserable.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow  for I have seen yesterday and I love today.
author: William Allen White

quote: We are more disturbed by a calamity which threatens us than by one which has befallen us.
author: John Lancaster Spalding

quote: We need not be afraid of the future  for the future will be in our own hands.
author: Thomas E. Dewey

quote: It is never safe to look into the future with eyes of fear.
author: E. H. Harriman

quote: The future is called "perhaps " which is the only possible thing to call the future. And the important thing is not to allow that to scare you.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Cowardice ... is almost always simply a lack of ability to suspend the functioning of the imagination.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Anxiety is a thin stream of fear trickling through the mind. If encouraged  it cuts a channel into which all other thoughts are drained.
author: Arthur Somers Roche

quote: Most of the fear that spoils our life comes from attacking difficulties before we get to them.
author: Dr. Frank Crane

quote: Fear is created not by the world around us  but in the mind  by what we think is going to happen.
author: Elizabeth Gawain

quote: Proust has pointed out that the predisposition to love creates it's own objects: is this not also true of fear?
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Fear breeds fear.
author: Byron Janis

quote: Fear to let fall a drop and you spill a lot.
author: Malay proverb

quote: The truly fearless think of themselves as normal.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living  and your belief will help create the fact.
author: William James

quote: We are terrified by the idea of being terrified.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: That fear of missing out on things makes you miss out on everything.
author: Etty Hillesum

quote: He who fears being conquered is sure of defeat.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: What we fear comes to pass more speedily than what we hope.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: The greatest mistake you can make is to be continually fearing you will make one.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: The mere apprehension of a coming evil has put many into a situation of the utmost danger.
author: Lucan

quote: The thing we fear we bring to pass.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: How often the fear of one evil leads into a worse.
author: Nicolas Bouleau-Despreaux

quote: Fears are educated into us  and can  if we wish  be educated out.
author: Dr. Karl Menninger

quote: Love is what we are born with. Fear is what we learn.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: Human beings are born with just two basic fears. One is the fear of loud noises. The other is the fear of falling. All other fears must be learned.
author: Ronald Rood

quote: Needless fear and panic over disease or misfortune that seldom materialize are simply bad habits. By proper ventilation and illumination of the mind it is possible to cultivate tolerance  poise and real courage.
author: Elie Metchnikoff

quote: Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood.
author: Marie Curie

quote: We have to start teaching ourselves not to be afraid.
author: William Faulkner

quote: Victory over fear is the first spiritual duty of man.
author: Nicholas Berdyaev

quote: I am not afraid of storms  for I am learning how to sail my ship.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: One of the marks of a gift is to have the courage of it.
author: Katherine Anne Porter

quote: Part of being a champ is acting like a champ. You have to learn how to win and not run away when you lose. Everyone has bad stretches and real successes.
author: Nancy Kerrigan

quote: Fear of success can also be tied into the idea that success means someone else's loss. Some people are unconsciously guilty because they believe their victories are coming at the expense of another.
author: Joan C. Harvey

quote: Most people are afraid of failing. I think there's nothing wrong in failing.
author: Mark N. Cohen

quote: True success is overcoming the fear of being unsuccessful.
author: Paul Sweeney

quote: I'm afraid of being lazy and complacent. I'm afraid of taking myself too seriously.
author: Barbara Hershey

quote: The sheer rebelliousness in giving ourselves permission to fail frees a childlike awareness and clarity. ... When we give ourselves permission to fail  we at the same time give ourselves permission to excel.
author: Eloise Ristad

quote: He is much to be dreaded who stands in dread of poverty.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: I was nervous and confident at the same time  nervous about going out there in front of all of those people  with so much at stake  and confident that I was going to go out there and win.
author: Althea Gibson

quote: There are those who are so scrupulously afraid of doing wrong that they seldom venture to do anything.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Real courage is when you know you're licked before you begin  but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.
author: Harper Lee

quote: To be ambitious for wealth  and yet always expecting to be poor  to be always doubting your ability to get what you long for  is like trying to reach east by traveling west. ... No matter how hard you work for success  if your thought is saturated with the fear of failure  it will kill your efforts  neutralize your endeavors and make success impossible.
author: Charles Baudouin

quote: Studies by Medical Corps psychiatrists of combat fatigue cases ... found that fear of killing  rather than fear of being killed  was the most common cause of battle failure  and that fear of failure ran a strong second.
author: S. L. A. Marshall

quote: Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail. Failure is another step-pingstone to greatness.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Half the things that people do not succeed in are through fear of making the attempt.
author: James Northcote

quote: A champion is afraid of losing. Everyone else is afraid of winning.
author: Billie Jean King

quote: We fear our highest possibility (as well as our lowest one). We are generally afraid to become that which we can glimpse in our most perfect moments.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: We fear the thing we want the most.
author: Dr. Robert Anthony

quote: We should not let our fears hold us back from pursuing our hopes.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The ambitious climb high and perilous stairs  and never care how to come down  the desire of rising hath swallowed up their fear of a fall.
author: Thomas Adams

quote: It is not death that a man should fear  he should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Don't be afraid your life will end  be afraid it will never begin.
author: Grace Hansen

quote: Some people are so afraid to die that they never begin to live.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: Death is the last enemy: once we've got past that I think everything will be all right.
author: Alice Thomas Ellis

quote: The worst of all fears is the fear of living.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Life is to life in such a way that we are not afraid to die.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: Those who fear life are already three parts dead.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Fear not that thy life shall come to an end  but rather that it shall never have a beginning.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: People living deeply have no fear of death.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Fear of death is worse than dying.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: The fear of life is the favorite disease of the twentieth century.
author: William Lyon Phelps

quote: Too many people are thinking of security instead of opportunity. They are more afraid of life than death.
author: James F. Byrnes

quote: Death does not frighten me  but dying obscurely and above all uselessly does.
author: Isabelle Eberhardt

quote: Fear of life in one form or another is the great thing to exorcise.
author: William James

quote: If we let things terrify us  life will not be worth living.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: A good life fears not life  nor death.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: He who fears death cannot enjoy life.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Healthy children will not fear life if their elders have integrity enough not to fear death.
author: Erik H. Erikson

quote: To live your life in the fear of losing it is to lose the point of life.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: It is not death we fear  but the thought of it.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: It is not death or pain that is to be dreaded  but the fear of pain or death.
author: Epictetus

quote: Death is not the enemy  living in constant fear of it is.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: We must act in spite of fear ... not because of it.
author: Anonymous

quote: I have accepted fear as a part of life-specifically the fear of change. ... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....
author: Erica Jong

quote: Go forth to meet the shadowy Future without fear and with a manly heart.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: I may be compelled to face danger  but never fear it  and while our soldiers can stand and fight  I can stand and feed and nurse them.
author: Clara Barton

quote: The fishermen know that the sea is dangerous and the storm terrible  but they have never found these dangers sufficient reason for remaining ashore.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: Fear is one thing. To let fear grab you and swing you around by the tail is another.
author: Katherine Paterson

quote: I have not ceased being fearful  but I have ceased to let fear control me.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Nothing puzzles me more than time and space  yet nothing troubles me less.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Uncertainty and expectation are the joys of life. Security is an insipid thing  and the overtaking and possessing of a wish  discovers the folly of the chase.
author: William Congreve

quote: When I lie down  I say  When shall I arise and the night be gone? And I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.
author: Bible

quote: If I had a formula for bypassing trouble  I wouldn't pass it around. Wouldn't be doing anybody a favour. Trouble creates a capacity to handle it. I don't say embrace trouble. That's as bad as treating it as an enemy. But I do say  meet it as a friend  for you'll see a lot of it and had better be on speaking terms with it.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Trouble is the common denominator of living. It is the great equalizer.
author: Ann Landers

quote: Trouble is a part of your life  and if you don't share it  you don't give the person who loves you a chance to love you enough.
author: Dinah Shore

quote: Anxiety is essential to the human condition. The confrontation with anxiety can relieve us from boredom  sharpen the sensitivity and assure the presence of tension that is necessary to preserve human existence.
author: Rollo May

quote: We poison our lives with fear of burglary and shipwreck  and  ask anyone  the house is never burgled  and the ship never goes down.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Neurosis is the way of avoiding non-being by avoiding being.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Anxiety is fear of one's self.
author: Wilhelm Stekel

quote: Fear ringed by doubt is my eternal moon.
author: Malcolm Lowry

quote: Worries go down better with soup than without.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: Neurotic means he is not as sensible as I am  and psychotic means he's even worse than my brother-in-law.
author: Karl Menninger

quote: Anxiety is the interest paid on trouble before it is due.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: Anxiety is a thin stream of fear trickling through the mind. If encouraged  it cuts a channel into which all other thoughts are drained.
author: Arthur Somers Roche

quote: There is a difference between a psychopath and a neurotic. A psychopath thinks two and two are five. A neurotic knows that two and two are four  but he worries about it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Worrying helps you some. It seems as if you are doing something when you're worrying.
author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

quote: Everything great in the world comes from neurotics. They alone have founded our religions  and composed our masterpieces. Never will the world know all it owes to them  nor all they have suffered to enrich us.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: For what human ill does not dawn seem to be an alleviation.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: No sensible person ever made an apology.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Apology is only egotism wrong side out.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: O wad some power the giftie gie us To see oursel's as ithers see us!
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: All that glisters is not gold.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Polished brass will pass upon more people than rough gold.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Handsome is that handsome does.
author: Henry Fielding

quote: Things are seldom what they seem  Skim milk masquerades as cream.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: Men in general judge more from appearances than from reality. All men have eyes  but few have the gift of penetration.
author: Machiavelli

quote: Whited sepulchres  which indeed appear beautiful outward  but are within full of dead men's bones.
author: Bible

quote: She looks as if butter wouldn't melt in her mouth.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Animals feed  man eats  die man of intellect alone knows how to eat.
author: Anthelme Brillat Savarin

quote: All philosophy in two words  - sustain and abstain.
author: Epictetus

quote: If you are surprised at the number of our maladies  count our cooks.
author: Seneca

quote: When someone does something well  applaud I You will make two people happy.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: He who praises another enriches himself far more than he does the one praised. To praise is an investment in happiness. The poorest human being has something to give that the richest could not buy.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: The way to develop the best that is in a man is by appreciation and encouragement.
author: Charles Schwab

quote: The applause of a single human being is of great consequence.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Most people like praise . . . When it is really deserved  most people expand under it into richer and better selves.
author: Joseph Farrell

quote: The sweetest of all sounds is praise.
author: Xenophon

quote: Down deep we really know our worth  but we don't have easy access to that knowledge. We need to hear praise coming from outside ourselves or we won't remember that we deserve it.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: Find the good - and praise it.
author: Alex Haley

quote: Every day  tell at least one person something you like  admire  or appreciate about them.
author: Richard Carlson

quote: Judicious praise is to children what the sun is to flowers. Christian Bovee A little praise Goes a great ways.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Art is much less important than life  but what a poor life without it.
author: Robert Motherwell

quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Without art  the crudeness of reality would make the world unbearable.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Art is a staple  like bread or wine or a warm coat in winter. Man's spirit grows hungry for art in the same way his stomach growls for food.
author: Irving Stone

quote: The object of art is to give life a shape.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: The artist has a special task and duty  the task of reminding men of their humanity and the promise of their creativity.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: Each of us is an artist  capable of conceiving and creating a vision from the depths of our being.
author: Dorothy Fadiman

quote: All that is good in art is the expression of one soul talking to another  and is precious according to the greatness of the soul that utters it.
author: John Ruskin

quote: The artist alone sees spirits. But after he has told of their appearing to him  everybody sees them.
author: Goethe

quote: Artists are nearest God. Into their souls he breathes his life  and from their hands it comes in fair  articulate forms to bless the world.
author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

quote: A work of art has an author and yet  when it is perfect  it has something which is anonymous about it.
author: Simone Weil

quote: The true work of art is but a shadow of the divine perfection.
author: Michelangelo

quote: The artist is the confidant of nature  flowers carry on dialogues with him through the graceful bending of their stems and the harmoniously tinted nuances of their blossoms. Every flower has a cordial word which nature directs towards him.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: There are painters who transform the sun to a yellow spot  but there are others who with the help of their art and their intelligence  transform a yellow spot into sun.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Science and art have that in common that everyday things seem to them new and attractive.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Art arises when the secret vision of the artist and the manifestation of nature agree to find new shapes.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Learning to draw is really a matter of learning to see - to see correctly - and that means a good deal more than merely looking with the eye.
author: Kimon Nicolaides

quote: Drawing is the discipline by which I constantly rediscover the world. I have learned that what I have not drawn  I have never really seen  and that when I start drawing an ordinary thing  I realize how extraordinary it is  sheer miracle.
author: Frederick Franck

quote: I shut my eyes in order to see.
author: Paul Gauguin

quote: Dancing is the loftiest  the most moving  the most beautiful of the arts  because it is no mere translation or abstraction from life  it is life itself.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: The body says what words cannot.
author: Martha Graham

quote: Dancing is the body made poetic.
author: Ernst Bacon

quote: The trouble with nude dancing is that not everything stops when the music stops.
author: Sir Robert Helpmann

quote: Let that day be lost to us on which we did not dance once I
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: If you can walk  you can dance. Zimbabwe saying Music is well said to be the speech of angels.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Music is the child of prayer  the companion of religion.
author: Chateaubriand

quote: Music is the art of the prophets  the only art that can calm the agitations of the soul  it is one of the most magnificent and delightful presents God has given us.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Musical training is a more potent instrument than any other  because rhythm and harmony find their way into the inward places of the soul.
author: Plato

quote: We are full of rhythms . . . our pulse  our gestures  our digestive tracts  the lunar and seasonal cycles.
author: Yehudi Menuhin

quote: When I hear music  I fear no danger. I am invulnerable. I see no foe. I am related to the earliest times  and to the latest.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The best  most beautiful  and most perfect way that we have of expressing a sweet concord of mind to each other is by music.
author: Jonathan Edwards

quote: When words leave off  music begins.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: After silence that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Music is the universal language of mankind.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: There is no feeling  except the extremes of fear and grief that does not find relief in music.
author: George Eliot

quote: Without music  life is a journey through a desert.
author: Pat Conroy

quote: I merely took the energy it takes to pout and wrote some blues.
author: Duke Ellington

quote: God respects me when I work  but loves me when I sing.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: We all have music inside us  and can learn how to get it out  one way or another.
author: Frank Wilson

quote: Poetry ennobles the heart and the eyes  and unveils the meaning of all things upon which the heart and the eyes dwell. It discovers the secret rays of the universe  and restores to us forgotten paradises.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: To read a poem in January is as lovely as to go for a walk in June.
author: Jean Paul

quote: Poetry is something to make us wiser and better  by continually revealing those types of beauty and truth  which God has set in all men's souls.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The poem is a little myth of man's capacity of making his life meaningful. And in the end  the poem is not a thing we see - it is  rather  a light by which we may see - and what we see is life.
author: Robert Penn Warren

quote: Poetry is the utterance of deep and heartfelt truth. The true poet is very near the oracle.
author: Edward Hubbell Chapin

quote: The poets are only the interpreters of the gods.
author: Socrates

quote: Poetry is simply the most beautiful  impressive  and widely effective mode of saying things.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: When power narrows the area of man's concern  poetry reminds him of the richness and diversity of his existence.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: When you read and understand a poem  comprehending its rich and formal meanings  then you master chaos a little.
author: Stephen Spender

quote: There is as much dignity in tilling a field as in writing a poem.
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: You will find poetry nowhere unless you bring some of it with you.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: The echo of a platitude.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Applause is the spur of noble minds  the end and aim of weak ones.
author: Walter Colton

quote: About the only person we ever heard of that wasn't spoiled by being lionized was a Jew named Daniel.
author: G. D. Prentice

quote: Architecture is a continuing dialogue between generations which creates an environment across time.
author: Vincent Scully

quote: Why can't we have those curves and arches that express feeling in design? What is wrong with them? Why has everything got to be vertical  straight  unbending  only at right angles - and functional?
author: Charles, Prince of Wales

quote: You have to give this much to the Luftwaffe - when it knocked down our buildings it did not replace them with anything more offensive than rubble. We did that.
author: Charles, Prince of Wales

quote: To be an architect is to possess an individual voice speaking a generally understood language of form.
author: Robert A. M. Stern

quote: In architecture the pride of man  his triumph over gravitation  his will to power  assume a visible form. Architecture is a sort of oratory of power by means of forms.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: The materials of city planning are sky  space  trees  steel and cement in that order and in that hierarchy.
author: Le Corbusier

quote: Buildings should be good neighbours.
author: Paul Thiry

quote: Pictures deface walls oftener than they decorate them.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Life is rich  always changing  always challenging  and we architects have the task of transmitting into wood  concrete  glass and steel  of transforming human aspirations into habitable and meaningful space.
author: Arthur Erickson

quote: A building is a string of events belonging together.
author: Chris Fawcett

quote: Good architecture is like a piece of beautifully composed music crystallized in space that elevates our spirits beyond the limitation of time.
author: Tao Ho

quote: Architecture (is) a theatre stage setting where the leading actors are the people  and to dramatically direct the dialogue between these people and space is the technique of designing.
author: Kisho Kurokawa

quote: I saw the bathroom fixtures as a kind of American Trinity.
author: Claes Oldenberg

quote: Perspective is worth 80 I.Q. points.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Architecture is the will of an epoch translated into space.
author: Mies van der Rohe

quote: When you look on one of your contemporary 'good copies' of historical remains  ask yourself the question: Not what style  but in what civilization is this building? And the absurdity  vulgarity  anachronism and solecism of the modern structure will be revealed to you in a most startling fashion.
author: Louis H. Sullivan

quote: Light  God's eldest daughter  is a principal beauty in a building.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: No architecture can be truly noble which is not imperfect.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Architecture is inhabited sculpture.
author: Constantin Brancusi

quote: The flowering of geometry.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Society needs a good image of itself. That is the job of the architect.
author: Walter Gropius

quote: Architecture begins when you place two bricks carefully together.
author: Mies van der Rohe

quote: An arch never sleeps.
author: Hindu proverb

quote: Develop an infallible technique and then place yourself at the mercy of inspiration.
author: Ralph Rapson

quote: The reality of the building does not consist in the roof and walls  but in the space within to be lived in.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Good architecture lets nature in.
author: Mario Pei

quote: Architecture should be dedicated to keeping the outside out and the inside in.
author: Leonard Baskin

quote: Early in life I had to choose between arrogance and hypocritical humility. I chose honest arrogance and have seen no occasion to change.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: No house should ever be on a hill  or on anything. It should be of the hill. Hill and house should live together  each the happier for the other.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: How can we expect our students to become bold and fearless in thought and action if we encase them in sentimental shrines feigning a culture which has long since disappeared?
author: Walter Gropius

quote: The house does not frame the view: it projects the beholder into it.
author: Harwell Hamilton Harris

quote: Architecture is space structured to serve man and to move him.
author: Etienne Gaboury

quote: Take nothing for granted as beautiful or ugly  but take every building to pieces  and challenge every feature. Learn to distinguish the curious from the beautiful. Get the habit of analysis - analysis will in time enable synthesis to become your habit of mind. 'Think simples' as my old master used to say - meaning to reduce the whole of its parts into the simplest terms  getting back to first principles.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Always design a thing by considering it in its next larger context - a chair in a room  a room in a house  a house in an environment  an environment in a city plan.
author: Eero Saarinen

quote: In speculative buildings  which is most of our business  there are really only three chances to make architecture: the lobby or entrance sequence  the top and the elevator cab.
author: Chao-Ming Wu

quote: A house is a machine for living.
author: Buckminster Fuller

quote: A doctor can bury his mistakes  but an architect can only advise his clients to plant vines.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: The White House was designed by Hoban  a noted Irish-American architect  and I have no doubt that he believed by incorporating several features of the Dublin style he would make it more homelike for any President of Irish descent. It was a long wait  but I appreciate his efforts.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Genius is personal  decided by fate  but it expresses itself by means of system. There is no work of art without system.
author: Le Corbusier

quote: We shape our buildings  thereafter they shape us.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: I call architecture 'petrified music'.
author: Goethe

quote: Form ever follows function.
author: Louis H. Sullivan

quote: Old houses mended  Cost little less than new before they're ended.
author: Anonymous

quote: Architecture is frozen music.
author: Goethe

quote: Ah  to build  to build! That is the noblest of all the arts.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Arguments out of a petty mouth are unanswerable.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Many can argue  not many converse.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Wise men argue causes  and fools decide them.
author: Anacharsis

quote: When Bishop Berkeley said  "there was no matter " And proved it - 'twas no matter what he said.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Neither irony nor sarcasm is argument.
author: Rufus Choate

quote: I am bound to furnish my antagonists with arguments  but not with comprehension.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Strong and bitter words indicate a weak cause.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Insolence is not logic  epithets are the arguments of malice.
author: Charles J. Ingersoll

quote: Myself when young did eagerly frequent Doctor and Saint  and heard great argument About it and about: but evermore Came out by the same door where in I went.
author: Omar Khayyam
