quote: As I got warmed up  and felt perfectly at home in talk  I heard myself boasting  lying  exaggerating. Oh  not deliberately  far from it. It would be unconvivial and dull to stop and arrest the flow of talk  and speak only after carefully considering whether I was telling the truth.
author: Bernard Berenson

quote: Men always talk about the most important things to perfect strangers.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Not a sentence or a word is independent of the circumstances under which it is uttered.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Communication is and should be hell fire and sparks as well as sweetness and light.
author: Aman Vivian Rakoff

quote: The really important things are said over cocktails and are never done.
author: Peter F. Drucker

quote: You never say a word of yourself  dear Lady Grey. You have that dreadful sin of anti-egotism.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: The real art of conversation is not only to say the right thing in the right place but to leave unsaid the wrong thing at the tempting moment.
author: Dorothy Nevill

quote: Listen or thy tongue will keep thee deaf.
author: American Indian proverb

quote: People love to talk but hate to listen. Listening is not merely not talking  though even that is beyond most of our powers  it means taking a vigorous  human interest in what is being told us. You can listen like a blank wall or like a splendid auditorium where every sound comes back fuller and richer.
author: Alice Duer Miller

quote: A man who listens because he has nothing to say can hardly be a source of inspiration. The only listening that counts is that of the talker who alternately absorbs and expresses ideas.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: When I think over what I have said  I envy dumb people.
author: Seneca

quote: That is the happiest conversation where there is no competition  no vanity  but a calm quiet interchange of sentiments.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: John Wesley's conversation is good  but he is never at leisure. He is always obliged to go at a certain hour. This is very disagreeable to a man who loves to fold his legs and have his talk out as I do.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: She had lost the art of conversation  but not  unfortunately  the power of speech.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Too much agreement kills a chat.
author: Eldridge Cleaver

quote: You can never hope to become a skilled conversationalist until you learn how to put your foot tactfully through the television set.
author: M. Dale Baughman

quote: Some persons talk simply because they think sound is more manageable than silence.
author: Margaret Halsey

quote: While the right to talk may be the beginning of freedom  the necessity of listening is what makes the right important.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: Listening is a magnetic and strange thing  a creative force. The friends who listen to us are the ones we move toward  and we want to sit in their radius. When we are listened to  it creates us  makes us unfold and expand.
author: Karl Menninger

quote: A ceremony of self-wastage - good talkers are miserable  they know that they have betrayed themselves  that they have taken material which should have a life of its own  to disperse it in noises upon the air.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Wit is the salt of conversation  not the food.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Debate is masculine  conversation is feminine.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Never hold any one by the button or the hand in order to be heard out  for if people are unwilling to hear you  you had better hold your tongue than them.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Conversation enriches the understanding  but solitude is the school of genius.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: Silence is one great art of conversation.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Conceit causes more conversation than wit.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: The less men think  the more they talk.
author: Charles Montesquieu

quote: A conservative believes nothing should be done for the first time.
author: Lynwood L. Giacomini

quote: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for  the evidence of things not seen.
author: Bible

quote: Genuine blasphemy  genuine in spirit and not purely verbal  is the product of partial belief  and is as impossible to the complete atheist as to the perfect Christian.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: I believe in the gods. Or rather  I believe that I believe in the gods. But I don't believe that they are great brooding presences watching over us  I believe they are completely absent-minded.
author: Jean Giraudoux

quote: I think that a society cannot live without a certain number of irrational beliefs. They are protected from criticism and analysis because they are irrational.
author: Claude Levi-Strauss

quote: What is dangerous about extremists is not that they are extreme  but that they are intolerant. The evil is not what they say about their cause  but what they say about their opponents.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quote: It is a perplexing and unpleasant truth that when men already have 'something worth fighting for'  they do not feel like fighting.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Martyrdom has always been a proof of the intensity  never of the correctness of a belief.
author: Arthur Schnitzler

quote: Belief is better than anything else  and it is best when rapt - above paying its respects to anybody's doubt whatsoever.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The peak of tolerance is most readily achieved by those who are not burdened with convictions.
author: Alexander Chase

quote: A belief is not merely an idea the mind possesses  it is an idea that possesses the mind.
author: Robert Bolton

quote: Every man who attacks my belief diminishes in some degree my confidence in it  and therefore makes me uneasy  and I am angry with him who makes me uneasy.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Penetrating so many secrets  we cease to believe in the unknowable. But there it sits nevertheless  calmly licking its chops.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Believe not your own brother - believe  instead  your own blind eye.
author: Russian proverb

quote: Whether you are really right or not doesn't matter  it's the belief that counts.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: I love an opposition that has convictions.
author: Frederick the Great

quote: Every man  wherever he goes  is encompassed by a cloud of comforting convictions  which move with him like flies on a summer day.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Convictions are the mainsprings of action  the driving powers of life. What a man lives are his convictions.
author: Bishop Francis Kelly

quote: The best lack all conviction  while the worst Are full of passionate intensity.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: (Conviction) is possible only in a world more primitive than ours can be perceived to be. A man can achieve a simply gnomic conviction only by ignoring the radical describers of his environment  or by hating them  as convinced men have hated  say  Darwin and Freud  as agents of some devil.
author: John Ciardi

quote: Those who serve a cause are not those who love that cause. They are those who love the life which has to be led in order to serve it - except in the case of the very purest  and they are rare.
author: Simone Weil

quote: The great thing in this world is not so much where we stand  as in what direction we are moving.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Orthodoxy is my doxy - heterodoxy is another man's doxy.
author: William Warburton

quote: Every dogma has its day.
author: Abraham Rotstein

quote: A man can believe in a considerable deal of rubbish  and yet go about his daily work in a rational and cheerful manner.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: Every life is a possession of faith  and exercises an inevitable and silent propaganda.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Soon after a hard decision something inevitably occurs to cast doubt. Holding steady against that doubt usually proves the decision.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: I may have faults but being wrong ain't one of them.
author: Jimmy Hoffa

quote: The discovery of a new dish does more for human happiness than the discovery of a new star.
author: Anthelme Brillat Savarin

quote: We may live without friends  we may live without books  But civilized man cannot live without cooks.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Too many cooks spoil the broth.
author: English proverb

quote: God sends meat  and the Devil sends cooks.
author: John Taylor

quote: The more corrupt the state  the more laws.
author: Tacitus

quote: Just for a handful of silver he left us  Just for a ribbon to stick in his coat.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: If the chief party  whether it be the people  or the army  or the nobility  which you think most useful and of most consequence to you for the conservation of your dignity  be corrupt  you must follow their humor and indulge them  and in that case honesty and virtue are pernicious.
author: Machiavelli

quote: I consider it the best part of an education to have been born and brought up in the country
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: The town is man's world  but this (country life) is of God.
author: William Cowper

quote: In Chinese  the word for crisis is weiji  composed of the character wei  which means danger  and ji  which means opportunity.
author: Jan Wong

quote: My advice to you  if you should ever be in a hold up  is to line up with the cowards and save your bravery for an occasion when it may be of some benefit to you.
author: O. Henry

quote: It is easy enough to praise men for the courage of their convictions. I wish I could teach the sad young of this mealy generation the courage of their confusions.
author: John Ciardi

quote: It takes a kind of shabby arrogance to survive in our time  and a fairly romantic nature to want to.
author: Edgar Z. Friedenberg

quote: Growth demands a temporary surrender of security.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anais Nin

quote: No one provokes me with impunity (nemo me impune lacessit)
author: Motto of Scotland

quote: Neither have they hearts to stay  Nor wit enough to run away.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Respectability: the offspring of a liaison between a bald head and a bank account.
author: Anonymous

quote: Until the day of his death  no man can be sure of his courage.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: There is no such thing as bravery  only degrees of fear.
author: John Wainwright

quote: "Why not" is a slogan for an interesting life.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: You don't learn to hold your own in the world by standing on guard  but by attacking  and getting well hammered yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Here I stand. I can do no other. God help me. Amen.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Many become brave when brought to bay.
author: Norwegian proverb

quote: O God  give us serenity to accept what cannot be changed  courage to change what should be changed  and wisdom to distinguish the one from the other.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: The first virtue in a soldier is endurance of fatigue  courage is only the second virtue.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
author: George S. Patton

quote: We could be cowards  if we had courage enough.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Showing up is eighty percent of life.
author: Woody Allen

quote: A high station in life is earned by the gallantry with which appalling experiences are survived with grace.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: A decline in courage may be the most striking feature which an outside observer notices in the West in our days. The Western world has lost its civic courage  both as a whole and separately  in each country  in each government  in each political party  and  of course  in the United Nations. Such a decline in courage is particularly noticeable among the ruling groups and the intellectual elite  causing an impression that the loss of courage extends to the entire society.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: Courage is doing what you're afraid to do. There can be no courage unless you're scared.
author: Eddie Rickenbacker

quote: One man with courage makes a majority.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: If one is forever cautious  can one remain a human being?
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way. And don't pray when it rains if you don't pray when the sun shines.
author: Satchel Paige

quote: The Ancient Mariner said to Neptune during a great storm  'O God  you will save me if you wish  but I am going to go on holding my tiller straight.'
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Fight on  my merry men all  I'm a little wounded  but I am not slain  I will lay me down for to bleed a while  Then I'll rise and fight with you again.
author: John Dryden

quote: The paradox of courage is that a man must be a little careless of his life even in order to keep it.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: The last thing a woman will consent to discover in a man whom she loves  or on whom she simply depends  is want of courage.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Please understand there is no depression in this house and we are not interested in the possibilities of defeat. They do not exist.
author: Victoria, Queen of England

quote: Now the trumpet summons us again - not as a call to bear arms  though arms we need  not as a call to battle  though embattled we are  but a call to bear the burden of a long twilight struggle  year in and year out  'rejoicing in hope  patient in tribulation'  a struggle against the common enemies of man: tyranny  poverty  disease and war itself.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: To be brave one short instant is no easy matter  it is easier to die for a cause than to live for it.
author: Comtesse Diane

quote: The courage we desire and prize is not the courage to die decently  but to live manfully.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Have the courage to act instead of react.
author: Earlene Larson Jenks

quote: Courage! I have shown it for years  think you I shall lose it at the moment when my sufferings are to end?
author: Marie Antoinette

quote: Necessity does the work of courage.
author: George Eliot

quote: Courage is a quality so necessary for maintaining virtue that it is always respected  even when it is associated with vice.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The courage of life is often a less dramatic spectacle than the courage of a final moment  but it is no less a magnificent mixture of triumph and tragedy. A man does what he must - in spite of personal consequences  in spite of obstacles and dangers and pressures - and that is the basis of all morality.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: He was a bold man that first ate an oyster.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Unless one says goodbye to what one loves  and unless one travels to completely new territories  one can expect merely a long wearing away of oneself.
author: Jean Dubuffet

quote: A decent boldness ever meets with friends.
author: Homer

quote: Courage is resistance to fear  mastery of fear  not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

quote: One doesn't discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time.
author: Andri Gide

quote: The fly ought to be used as the symbol of impertinence and audacity  for whilst all other animals shun man more than anything else  and run away even before he comes near them  the fly lights upon his very nose.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Valour lies just halfway between rashness and cowardice.
author: Cervantes

quote: Never undertake anything for which you wouldn't have the courage to ask the blessings of heaven.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: As to moral courage  I have very rarely met with the two o'clock in the morning kind. I mean unprepared courage  that which is necessary on an unexpected occasion  and which  in spite of the most unforeseen events  leaves full freedom of judgement and decision.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The guts carry the feet  not the feet the guts.
author: Cervantes

quote: Clothes and courage have much to do with each other.
author: Sara Jeannette Duncan

quote: A great part of courage is the courage of having done the thing before.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Courage - fear that has said its prayers.
author: Dorothy Bernard

quote: Courage is rightly esteemed the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees all others.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Constant exposure to dangers will breed contempt for them.
author: Seneca

quote: (Courage) a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger  and a mental willingness to endure it.
author: William T. Sherman

quote: Not simply one of the virtues but the form of every virtue at the testing point  which means at the point of highest reality.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: At the bottom of a good deal of the bravery that appears in the world there lurks a miserable cowardice. Men will face powder and steel because they cannot face public opinion.
author: E. H. Chapin

quote: Whether it be to failure or success  the first need of being is endurance -to endure with gladness if we can  with fortitude in any event.
author: Bliss Carman

quote: I'm not funny. What I am is brave.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: Courage is the first of the human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees all the others.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Courage to be is the key to revelatory power of the feminist revolution.
author: Mary Daly

quote: Without courage  all other virtues lose their meaning.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Success is never found. Failure is never fatal. Courage is the only thing.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Courage is the most important of all virtues  because without it we can't practice any other virtue with consistency.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Courage is not simply one of the virtues  but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Courage is the ladder on which all other virtues mount.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: Courage is the basic virtue for everyone so long as he continues to grow  to move ahead.
author: Rollo May

quote: Courage is the greatest of all the virtues. Because if you haven't courage  you may not have an opportunity to use any of the others.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The courage of life is often a less dramatic spectacle than the courage of a final moment  but it is no less a magnificent mixture of triumph and tragedy. A man does what he must- in spite of personal consequences  in spite of obstacles and dangers and pressures-and that is the basis of all morality.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Nothing but courage can guide life.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Wealth lost-something lost  Honor lost-much lost  Courage lost-all lost.
author: Old German proverb

quote: Why not go out on a limb? Isn't that where the fruit is?
author: Frank Scully

quote: In politics  guts is all.
author: Barbara Castle

quote: In difficult situations  when hope seems feeble  the boldest plans are safest.
author: Livy

quote: Courage is the best slayer-courage which attacketh  for in every attack there is the sound of triumph.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: He who finds Fortune on his side should go briskly ahead  for she is wont to favor the bold.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: That's what being young is all about. You have the courage and the daring to think that you can make a difference.
author: Ruby Dee

quote: It is better by noble boldness to run the risk of being subject to half of the evils we anticipate than to remain in cowardly listlessness for fear of what might happen.
author: Herodotus

quote: A decent boldness ever meets with friends.
author: Homer

quote: In times of stress  be bold and valiant.
author: Horace

quote: The brave venture anything.
author: Anonymous

quote: It is the bold man who every time does best  at home or abroad.
author: Homer

quote: Attacking is the only secret. Dare and the world always yields  or if it beats you sometimes  dare it again  and it will succumb.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: You don't learn to hold your own in the world by standing on guard  but by attacking  and getting well-hammered yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Fortune helps the brave.
author: Virgil

quote: Audacity augments courage  hesitation  fear.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Fortune reveres the brave  and overwhelms the cowardly.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: God helps the brave.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Fortune befriends the bold.
author: John Dryden

quote: Fortune and love favor the brave.
author: Ovid

quote: Fortune favors the audacious.
author: Erasmus

quote: Audacity has made kings.
author: Prosper Jolyot de Crebillion

quote: Audacity  more audacity  always audacity.
author: Georges Jacques Danton

quote: With audacity one can undertake anything.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Bravery and faith bring both material and spiritual rewards.
author: Preston Bradley

quote: He who loses wealth loses much  he who loses a friend loses more  but he who loses his courage loses all.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: True miracles are created by men when they use the courage and intelligence that God gave them.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Tender-handed stroke a nettle  and it stings you for your pains  Grasp it like a man of mettle  and it soft as silk remains.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Be content to stand in the light  and let the shadow fall where it will.
author: Mary W. Stewart

quote: Never forget that life can only be nobly inspired and rightly lived if you take it bravely and gallantly  as a splendid adventure in which you are setting out into an unknown country  to meet many a joy  to find many a comrade  to win and lose many a battle.
author: Annie Besant

quote: Life is the acceptance of responsibilities  or their evasion  it is a business of meeting obligations  or avoiding them.
author: Ben Ames Williams

quote: The superior man makes the difficulty to be overcome his first interest  success comes only later.
author: Confucius

quote: There were always in me  two women at least  one woman desperate and bewildered  who felt she was drowning and another who would leap into a scene  as upon a stage  conceal her true emotions because they were weaknesses  helplessness  despair  and present to the world only a smile  an eagerness  curiosity  enthusiasm  interest.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Facing it-always facing it-that's the way to get through. Face it!
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: If one is willing to do a thing he is afraid to do  he does not have to ... face a situation fearlessly  and [if] there is no situation to face  it falls away of its own weight.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn

quote: He shall fare well who confronts circumstances aright.
author: Plutarch

quote: He that handles a nettle tenderly is soonest stung.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: He who is afraid of every nettle should not piss in the grass.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Let us be brave in the face of adversity.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Only one feat is possible: not to have run away.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: There is something healthy and invigorating about direct action.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Confidence ... is directness and courage in meeting the facts of life.
author: John Dewey

quote: The man who most vividly realizes a difficulty is the man most likely to overcome it.
author: Joseph Farrell

quote: I believe half the unhappiness in life comes from people being afraid to go straight at things.
author: William J. Lock

quote: No man will succeed unless he is ready to face and overcome difficulties  and is prepared to assume responsibilities.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: The fly that doesn't want to be swatted is most secure when it lights on the fly-swatter.
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quote: The fly ought to be used as the symbol of impertinence and audacity  for whilst all other animals shun man more than anything else  and run away even before he comes near them  the fly lights upon his very nose.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: All problems become smaller if you don't dodge them  but confront them.
author: William F. Halsey

quote: The best way out of a problem is through it.
author: Anonymous

quote: We cannot solve life's problems except by solving them.
author: M. Scott Peck

quote: The truth will set you free  but first it will make you miserable.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Have the courage to face a difficulty lest it kick you harder than you bargain for.
author: Stanislaus

quote: A great man is one who seizes the vital issue in a complex question  what we might call the jugular vein of the whole organism  and spends his energies upon that.
author: Joseph Rickaby

quote: It is often wonderful how putting down on paper a clear statement of a case helps one to see  not perhaps the way out  but the way in.
author: Arthur Christopher Benson

quote: As a rule  what is out of sight disturbs men's minds more seriously than what they see.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: Every difficulty slurred over will be a ghost to disturb your repose later on.
author: Frederic Chopin

quote: Life is a battle in which we fall from wounds we receive in running away.
author: William L. Sullivan

quote: Fools  through false shame  conceal their open wounds.
author: Horace

quote: Let us not look back in anger  nor forward in fear  but around us in awareness.
author: James Thurber

quote: It takes courage to know when you ought to be afraid.
author: James A. Michener

quote: However mean your life is  meet it and live it  do not shun it and call it hard names. It is not so bad as you are.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Genius is an infinite capacity for taking life by the scruff of the neck.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: If you suppress grief too much  it can well redouble.
author: Moliere

quote: Bad weather always looks worse through a window.
author: Anonymous

quote: The frontiers are not east or west  north or south  but wherever a man fronts a fact.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Should I  after tea and cakes and ices  have the strength to force the moment to its crisis?
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Whatever you are trying to avoid won't go away until you confront it.
author: Anonymous

quote: None are so blind as those who will not see.
author: Anonymous

quote: You don't change the course of history by turning the faces of portraits to the wall.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: Soldiers  strike the foe in the face!
author: Florus

quote: Get in front of the ball  you won't get hurt. That's what you've got a chest for  young man.
author: John McGraw

quote: Knowledge of sin is the beginning of salvation.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Courage is a quietness  not martial music made Born of facing up to life  even when afraid.
author: Emily Sargent Councilman

quote: The great virtue in life is real courage that knows how to face facts and live beyond them.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Risk! Risk anything! ... Do the hardest thing on earth for you. Act for yourself. Face the truth.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: The first rule is to keep an untroubled spirit. The second is to look things in the face and know them for what they are.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: It is courage  courage  courage  that raises the blood of life to crimson splendor. Live bravely and present a brave front to adversity!
author: Horace

quote: It is easy to be brave from a safe distance.
author: Aesop

quote: Defending the truth is not something one does out of a sense of duty or to allay guilt complexes  but is a reward in itself.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: No blame should attach to telling the truth.
author: Anita Brookner

quote: The elegance of honesty needs no adornment.
author: Merry Browne

quote: Truth is always exciting. Speak it  then  life is dull without it.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: You cannot weave truth on a loom of lies.
author: Suzette Haden Elgin

quote: You're only as sick as your secrets.
author: Anonymous

quote: You can't expect to win unless you know why you lose.
author: Benjamin Lipson

quote: It takes great courage to break with one's past history and stand alone.
author: Marion Woodman

quote: We run away all the time to avoid coming face to face with ourselves.
author: Anonymous

quote: Awakening begins when a man realizes that he is going nowhere  and does not know where to go.
author: Georges Gurdjieff

quote: The naked truth is always better than the best-dressed lie.
author: Ann Landers

quote: If the word frankly or sincerely is not uttered in the first ten minutes-or let us speak openly-then you are not in the presence of a genuine businessman  and he will certainly go bankrupt.
author: Francoise Mallet-Joris

quote: The man with insight enough to admit his limitations comes nearest to perfection.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: If I ever said in grief or pride  I tired of honest things  I lied.
author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

quote: Truth  that fair goddess who comes always with healing in her wings.
author: Anne Shannon Monroe

quote: The confession of evil works is the first beginning of good works.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Admitting errors clears the score and proves you wiser than before.
author: Arthur Guiterman

quote: There is in the end no remedy but truth. It is the one course that cannot be evil.
author: Ellis Peters

quote: There is no power on earth more formidable than the truth.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

quote: If one cannot invent a really convincing lie  it is often better to stick to the truth.
author: Angela Thirkell

quote: An excuse is a lie guarded.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Honesty is the first chapter of the book of wisdom.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Truth is the vital breath of Beauty  Beauty the outward form of Truth.
author: Grace Aguilar

quote: The trouble with lying and deceiving is that their efficiency depends entirely upon a clear notion of the truth that the liar and deceiver wishes to hide.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: There is at least one thing more brutal than the truth  and that is the consequence of saying less than the truth.
author: Ti-Grace Atkinson

quote: The real gift of love is self disclosure.
author: John Powell

quote: We only really face up to ourselves when we are afraid.
author: Thomas Bernhard

quote: It takes a lot of courage to show your dreams to someone else.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: It takes more courage to reveal insecurities than to hide them  more strength to relate to people than to dominate them  more "manhood" to abide by thought-out principles rather than blind reflex. Toughness is in the soul and spirit  not in muscles and an immature mind.
author: Alex Karras

quote: I have often though morality may perhaps consist solely in the courage of making a choice.
author: Leon Blum

quote: Introversion  at least if extreme  is a sign of mental and spiritual immaturity.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: The highest courage is to dare to appear to be what one is.
author: John Lancaster Spalding

quote: It isn't for the moment you are stuck that you need courage  but for the long uphill climb back to sanity and faith and security.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: True courage is not the brutal force of vulgar heroes  but the firm resolve of virtue and reason.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Greatness  in the last analysis  is largely bravery-courage in escaping from old ideas and old standards.
author: James Harvey Robinson

quote: The highest courage is not to be found in the instinctive acts of men who risk their lives to save a friend or slay a foe  the physical fearlessness of a moment or an hour is not to be compared with immolation of months or years for the sake of wisdom or art.
author: Joseph H. Odell

quote: I have met brave women who are exploring the outer edge of human possibility  with no history to guide them  and with a courage to make themselves vulnerable that I find moving beyond words.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Valour is nobleness of the mind.
author: Anonymous

quote: Courage ... is nothing less than the power to overcome danger  misfortune  fear  injustice  while continuing to affirm inwardly that life  with all its sorrows  is good  that everything is meaningful  even if in a sense beyond our understanding  and that there is always tomorrow.
author: Dorothy Thompson

quote: This is the art of courage: to see things as they are and still believe that the victory lies not with those who avoid the bad  but those who taste  in living awareness  every drop of the good.
author: Victoria Lincoln

quote: God grant me the courage not to give up what I think is right  even though I think it is hopeless.
author: Admiral Chester W. Nimitz

quote: The great virtue in life is real courage that knows how to face facts and live beyond them.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Physical courage  which despises all danger  will make a man brave in one way  and moral courage  which despises all opinion  will make a man brave in another. The former would seem most necessary for the camp  the latter for the council  but to constitute a great man  both are necessary.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Courage is the power to let go of the familiar.
author: Raymond Lindquist

quote: Valor is stability  not of legs and arms  but of courage and the soul.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: One of man's finest qualities is described by the simple word "guts"-the ability to take it. If you have the discipline to stand fast when your body wants to run  if you can control your temper and remain cheerful in the face of monotony or disappointment  you have "guts" in the soldiering sense.
author: Colonel John S. Roosman

quote: Whatever course you decide upon  there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising which tempt you to believe that your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires ... courage.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Courage is more than standing for a firm conviction. It includes the risk of questioning that conviction.
author: Julian Weber Gordon

quote: The hallmark of courage in our age of conformity is the capacity to stand on one's convictions-not obstinately or defiantly (these are gestures of defensiveness  not courage) nor as a gesture of retaliation  but simply because these are what one believes.
author: Rollo May

quote: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak  courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
author: Anonymous

quote: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: Courage is to take hard knocks like a man when occasion calls.
author: Plautus

quote: You don't develop courage by being happy in your relationships everyday. You develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: This is courage ... to bear unflinchingly what heaven sends.
author: Euripides

quote: Courage  in the final analysis  is nothing but an affirmative answer to the shocks of existence.
author: Dr. Kurt Goldstein

quote: Courage is a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger  and a mental willingness to endure it.
author: General William T. Sherman

quote: To have courage for whatever comes in life-everything lies in that.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: To accept whatever comes  regardless of the consequences  is to be unafraid.
author: John Cage

quote: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority.
author: Ralph W. Sockman

quote: One man with courage makes a majority.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: Many women miss their greatest chance of happiness through a want of courage in a decisive moment.
author: Winifred Gordon

quote: We must have the courage to be happy.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: There is a courage of happiness as well as a courage of sorrow.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: Happy the man who ventures boldly to defend what he holds dear.
author: Ovid

quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: There is nothing in the world so much admired as a man who knows how to bear unhappiness with courage.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: We must have courage to bet on our ideas  on the calculated risk  and to act. Everyday living requires courage if life is to be effective and bring happiness.
author: Maxwell Maltz

quote: Faint heart never won fair lady.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: The last thing a woman will consent to discover in a man whom she loves  or on whom she simply depends  is want of courage.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: None but the brave deserve the fair.
author: John Dryden

quote: Fortune and love favor the brave.
author: Ovid

quote: The bravest are the tenderest. The loving are the daring.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The weapon of the brave is in his heart.
author: Anonymous

quote: The guts carry the feet  not the feet the guts.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: I am not afraid of a fight  I have to do my duty  come what may.
author: Therese of Lisieux

quote: War is fear cloaked in courage.
author: General William Westmoreland

quote: A bold heart is half the battle.
author: Anonymous

quote: Courage in danger is half the battle.
author: Plautus

quote: A man of courage never wants weapons.
author: Anonymous

quote: A brave arm makes a short sword long.
author: Anonymous

quote: Courage which goes against military expediency is stupidity  or  if it is insisted upon by a commander  irresponsibility.
author: Field Marshal Erwin Rommel

quote: There is  in addition to a courage with which men die  a courage by which men must live.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Where life is more terrible than death  it is the truest valor to dare to live.
author: Sir Thomas Browne

quote: The courage we desire and prize is not the courage to die decently  but to live manfully.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Often the test of courage is not to die  but to live.
author: Conte Vittorio Alfieri

quote: He who has the courage to laugh is almost as much the master of the world as he who is ready to die.
author: Giacomo Leopardi

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Only those are fit to live who are not afraid to die.
author: General Douglas MacArthur

quote: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: To say yes  you have to sweat and roll up your sleeves and plunge both hands into life up to the elbows. It is easy to say no  even if saying no means death.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Have the courage to live. Anyone can die.
author: Robert Cody

quote: Because a fellow has failed once or twice or a dozen times  you don't want to set him down as a failure till he's dead or loses his courage-and that's the same thing.
author: George Horace Lorimer

quote: What is more mortifying than to feel that you have missed the plum for want of courage to shake the tree?
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Yesterday I dared to struggle. Today I dare to win.
author: Bernadette Devlin

quote: To persevere  trusting in what hopes he has  is courage. The coward despairs.
author: Euripides

quote: It takes vision and courage to create- it takes faith and courage to prove.
author: Owen D. Young

quote: Whatever you do  you need courage. ... To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage which a soldier needs.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Who dares nothing  need hope for nothing.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Have the courage of your desire.
author: George R. Gissing

quote: To see what is right  and not do it  is want of courage.
author: Confucius

quote: No great thing conies to any man unless he has courage.
author: Cardinal James Gibbons

quote: Great things are done more through courage than through wisdom.
author: German proverb

quote: Courage permits the caliber of performance to continue at its peak  until the finish line is crossed.
author: Stuart Walker

quote: Failure is only postponed success as long as courage "coaches" ambition. The habit of persistence is the habit of victory.
author: Herbert Kaufman

quote: Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman  before which difficulties disappear  and obstacles vanish into air.
author: John Quincy Adams

quote: There are a lot of fellas with all the ability it takes to play in the major leagues  but... they always get stuck in the minor leagues because they haven't got the guts to make the climb.
author: Cookie Lavagetto

quote: Where there is a brave man  in the thickest of the fight  there is the post of honor.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: It takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeeded.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: You will never do anything in this world without courage.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: Whenever you see a successful business  someone once made a courageous decision.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: Courage to start and willingness to keep everlasting at it are the requisites for success.
author: Alonzo Newton Benn

quote: One of the biggest factors in success is the courage to undertake something.
author: James A. Worsham

quote: Everyone has a talent. What is rare is the courage to follow that talent to the dark place where it leads.
author: Erica Jong

quote: The world is not perishing for the want of clever or talented or well-meaning men. It is perishing for the want of men of courage and resolution.
author: Robert J. McCracken

quote: Talent is helpful in writing  but guts are absolutely necessary.
author: Jessamyn West

quote: Knowledge without courage is sterile.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: To create one's own world in any of the arts takes courage.
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quote: Courage is the thing. All goes if courage goes.
author: Sir James M. Barrie

quote: It's weak and despicable to go on wanting things and not trying to get them.
author: Joanna Field

quote: How many feasible projects have miscarried through despondency  and been strangled in their birth by a cowardly imagination?
author: Jeremy Collier

quote: It is brave to be involved.
author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quote: One of the biggest factors in success is the courage to undertake something.
author: James A. Worsham

quote: When it comes to betting on yourself ... you're a chicken-livered coward if you hesitate.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: Be courageous! ... I have seen many depressions in business. Always America has come out stronger and more prosperous. Be as brave as your fathers before you. Have faith! Go forward.
author: Thomas A. Edison
